types.name: ChannelClosingTransaction
types.description: This is an object representing a transaction which closes a channel on the Lightning Network. This operation allocates balances back to the local and remote nodes.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of this entity across all Lightspark systems. Should be treated as an opaque string.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The date and time when this transaction was initiated.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The date and time when the entity was last updated.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of this transaction.

fields.name: resolved_at
fields.description: The date and time when this transaction was completed or failed.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of money involved in this transaction.

fields.name: transaction_hash
fields.description: The hash of this transaction, so it can be uniquely identified on the Lightning Network.

fields.name: fees
fields.description: The fees that were paid by the node for this transaction.

fields.name: block_hash
fields.description: The hash of the block that included this transaction. This will be null for unconfirmed transactions.

fields.name: block_height
fields.description: The height of the block that included this transaction. This will be zero for unconfirmed transactions.

fields.name: destination_addresses
fields.description: The Bitcoin blockchain addresses this transaction was sent to.

fields.name: num_confirmations
fields.description: The number of blockchain confirmations for this transaction in real time.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: If known, the channel this transaction is closing.

types.name: Entity

fields.description: The unique identifier of this entity across all Lightspark systems. Should be treated as an opaque string.

fields.name: created_at

types.name: DateTime
types.description: Date with time (isoformat)

types.name: TransactionStatus
types.description: This is an enum of the potential statuses a transaction associated with your Lightspark Node can take.

enumValues.name: SUCCESS
enumValues.description: Transaction succeeded.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: Transaction failed.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: Transaction has been initiated and is currently in-flight.

enumValues.name: NOT_STARTED
enumValues.description: For transaction type PAYMENT_REQUEST only. No payments have been made to a payment request.

enumValues.name: EXPIRED
enumValues.description: For transaction type PAYMENT_REQUEST only. A payment request has expired.

enumValues.name: CANCELLED
enumValues.description: For transaction type PAYMENT_REQUEST only.

types.name: CurrencyAmount
types.description: This object represents the value and unit for an amount of currency.

fields.name: original_value
fields.description: The original numeric value for this CurrencyAmount.

fields.name: original_unit
fields.description: The original unit of currency for this CurrencyAmount.

fields.name: preferred_currency_unit
fields.description: The unit of user's preferred currency.

fields.name: preferred_currency_value_rounded
fields.description: The rounded numeric value for this CurrencyAmount in the very base level of user's preferred currency. For example, for USD, the value will be in cents.

fields.name: preferred_currency_value_approx
fields.description: The approximate float value for this CurrencyAmount in the very base level of user's preferred currency. For example, for USD, the value will be in cents.

types.name: Long
types.description: The `Long` scalar type represents a 64 bit integer.

types.name: CurrencyUnit
types.description: This enum identifies the unit of currency associated with a CurrencyAmount.

enumValues.name: BITCOIN
enumValues.description: Bitcoin is the cryptocurrency native to the Bitcoin network. It is used as the native medium for value transfer for the Lightning Network.

enumValues.name: SATOSHI
enumValues.description: 0.00000001 (10e-8) Bitcoin or one hundred millionth of a Bitcoin. This is the unit most commonly used in Lightning transactions.

enumValues.name: MILLISATOSHI
enumValues.description: 0.001 Satoshi, or 10e-11 Bitcoin. We recommend using the Satoshi unit instead when possible.

enumValues.name: USD
enumValues.description: United States Dollar.

enumValues.name: MXN
enumValues.description: Mexican Peso.

enumValues.name: PHP
enumValues.description: Philippine Peso.

enumValues.name: NANOBITCOIN
enumValues.description: 0.000000001 (10e-9) Bitcoin or a billionth of a Bitcoin. We recommend using the Satoshi unit instead when possible.

enumValues.name: MICROBITCOIN
enumValues.description: 0.000001 (10e-6) Bitcoin or a millionth of a Bitcoin. We recommend using the Satoshi unit instead when possible.

enumValues.name: MILLIBITCOIN
enumValues.description: 0.001 (10e-3) Bitcoin or a thousandth of a Bitcoin. We recommend using the Satoshi unit instead when possible.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Channel
types.description: This is an object representing a channel on the Lightning Network. You can retrieve this object to get detailed information on a specific Lightning Network channel.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of this entity across all Lightspark systems. Should be treated as an opaque string.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The date and time when the entity was first created.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The date and time when the entity was last updated.

fields.name: funding_transaction
fields.description: The transaction that funded the channel upon channel opening.

fields.name: capacity
fields.description: The total amount of funds in this channel, including the channel balance on the local node, the channel balance on the remote node and the on-chain fees to close the channel.

fields.name: local_balance
fields.description: The channel balance on the local node.

fields.name: local_unsettled_balance
fields.description: The channel balance on the local node that is currently allocated to in-progress payments.

fields.name: remote_balance
fields.description: The channel balance on the remote node.

fields.name: remote_unsettled_balance
fields.description: The channel balance on the remote node that is currently allocated to in-progress payments.

fields.name: unsettled_balance
fields.description: The channel balance that is currently allocated to in-progress payments.

fields.name: total_balance
fields.description: The total balance in this channel, including the channel balance on both local and remote nodes.

fields.name: uptime_percentage
fields.description: An integer between 0 and 100 (included) that represents the percentage of uptime for this channel.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: A connection to all transactions that have occurred on the channel including outgoing payments, incoming payments, routing transactions and on-chain transactions.
fields.deprecationReason: Use account.transactions filtering with lightning_node_id instead.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of this channel.

fields.name: estimated_force_closure_wait_minutes
fields.description: The estimated time to wait for the channel's hash timelock contract to expire when force closing the channel. It is in unit of minutes.

fields.name: commit_fee
fields.description: The amount to be paid in fees for the current set of commitment transactions.

fields.name: fees
fields.description: The fees charged for routing payments through this channel.
fields.deprecationReason: Customer nodes do not route payments anymore.

fields.name: remote_node
fields.description: If known, the remote node of the channel.

fields.name: local_node
fields.description: The local Lightspark node of the channel.

fields.name: short_channel_id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the channel on Lightning Network, which is the location in the chain that the channel was confirmed. The format is <block-height>:<tx-index>:<tx-output>.

fields.name: count
fields.description: The total count of objects in this connection, using the current filters. It is different from the number of objects returned in the current page (in the `entities` field).

fields.name: average_fee
fields.description: The average fee for the transactions that transited through this channel, according to the filters and constraints of the connection.

fields.name: total_amount_transacted
fields.description: The total amount transacted for the transactions that transited through this channel, according to the filters and constraints of the connection.

fields.name: total_fees
fields.description: The total amount of fees for the transactions that transited through this channel, according to the filters and constraints of the connection.

types.name: TransactionType
types.description: This is an enum of the potential types of transactions that can be associated with your Lightspark Node.

enumValues.name: OUTGOING_PAYMENT
enumValues.description: Transactions initiated from a Lightspark node on Lightning Network.

enumValues.name: INCOMING_PAYMENT
enumValues.description: Transactions received by a Lightspark node on Lightning Network.

enumValues.name: ROUTED
enumValues.description: Transactions that forwarded payments through Lightspark nodes on Lightning Network.

enumValues.name: L1_WITHDRAW
enumValues.description: Transactions on the Bitcoin blockchain to withdraw funds from a Lightspark node to a Bitcoin wallet.

enumValues.name: L1_DEPOSIT
enumValues.description: Transactions on Bitcoin blockchain to fund a Lightspark node's wallet.

enumValues.name: CHANNEL_OPEN
enumValues.description: Transactions on Bitcoin blockchain to open a channel on Lightning Network funded by the local Lightspark node.

enumValues.name: CHANNEL_CLOSE
enumValues.description: Transactions on Bitcoin blockchain to close a channel on Lightning Network where the balances are allocated back to local and remote nodes.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT
enumValues.description: Transactions initiated from a Lightspark node on Lightning Network.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_REQUEST
enumValues.description: Payment requests from a Lightspark node on Lightning Network
enumValues.deprecationReason: Use INCOMING_PAYMENT for received payments. To query payment requests, use payment_requests on Account.

enumValues.name: ROUTE
enumValues.description: Transactions that forwarded payments through Lightspark nodes on Lightning Network.

types.name: ChannelStatus
types.description: This is an enum representing the status of a channel on the Lightning Network.

enumValues.name: OK
enumValues.description: The channel is online and ready to send and receive funds.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The channel has been created, but the Bitcoin transaction that initiates it still needs to be confirmed on the Bitcoin blockchain.

enumValues.name: OFFLINE
enumValues.description: The channel is not available, likely because the peer is not online.

enumValues.name: UNBALANCED_FOR_SEND
enumValues.description: The channel is behaving properly, but its remote balance is much higher than its local balance so it is not balanced properly for sending funds out.

enumValues.name: UNBALANCED_FOR_RECEIVE
enumValues.description: The channel is behaving properly, but its remote balance is much lower than its local balance so it is not balanced properly for receiving funds.

enumValues.name: CLOSED
enumValues.description: The channel has been closed. Information about the channel is still available for historical purposes but the channel cannot be used anymore.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: Something unexpected happened and we cannot determine the status of this channel. Please try again later or contact the support.

types.name: ChannelFees

types.name: Node
types.description: This object is an interface representing a Lightning Node on the Lightning Network, and could either be a Lightspark node or a node managed by a third party.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of this entity across all Lightspark systems. Should be treated as an opaque string.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The date and time when the entity was first created.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The date and time when the entity was last updated.

fields.name: alias
fields.description: A name that identifies the node. It has no importance in terms of operating the node, it is just a way to identify and search for commercial services or popular nodes. This alias can be changed at any time by the node operator.

fields.name: bitcoin_network
fields.description: The Bitcoin Network this node is deployed in.

fields.name: color
fields.description: A hexadecimal string that describes a color. For example "#000000" is black, "#FFFFFF" is white. It has no importance in terms of operating the node, it is just a way to visually differentiate nodes. That color can be changed at any time by the node operator.

fields.name: conductivity
fields.description: A summary metric used to capture how well positioned a node is to send, receive, or route transactions efficiently. Maximizing a node's conductivity helps a node’s transactions to be capital efficient. The value is an integer ranging between 0 and 10 (bounds included).

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: The name of this node in the network. It will be the most human-readable option possible, depending on the data available for this node.

fields.name: public_key
fields.description: The public key of this node. It acts as a unique identifier of this node in the Lightning Network.

fields.name: addresses
fields.description: The addresses that this node has announced for itself on the Lightning Network.

enumValues.name: SIGNET

enumValues.name: TESTNET
enumValues.description: A test version of the Bitcoin Blockchain, publicly available.

types.name: Balances
types.description: This is an object representing the balance associated with your Lightspark account. You can retrieve this object to see your balance, which can be broken down into several different categorizations.

fields.name: owned_balance
fields.description:
This represents the balance that should be displayed when asked "how much do I own right now?".

It represents the amount currently owned, including things that may not be owned soon (e.g. in-flight outgoing payments, in-flight withdrawals, commit fees, etc.). It really is a snapshot of what is officially owned at this instant.

fields.name: available_to_send_balance
fields.description:
This represents the balance that should be displayed when asked "how much can I send on Lightning right now?".

It represents the amount currently available to be sent on the Lightning network. We remove from the balance all the funds that are temporarily locked (e.g. channel reserves).

fields.name: available_to_withdraw_balance
fields.description:
This represents the balance that should be displayed when asked "how much money can I withdraw on the Bitcoin network right now?".

It represents the amount currently available to withdraw and is usually equal to the `owned_balance` but it does not include in-flight operations (which would likely succeed and therefore likely make your withdrawal fail).

fields.description: The daily liquidity forecasts for the current page of this connection.

types.name: OutgoingPaymentAttempt
types.description: This object represents an attempted Lightning Network payment sent from a Lightspark Node. You can retrieve this object to receive payment related information about any payment attempt sent from your Lightspark Node on the Lightning Network, including any potential reasons the payment may have failed.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of this entity across all Lightspark systems. Should be treated as an opaque string.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The date and time when the entity was first created.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The date and time when the entity was last updated.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of an outgoing payment attempt.

fields.name: failure_code
fields.description: If the payment attempt failed, then this contains the Bolt #4 failure code.

fields.name: failure_source_index
fields.description: If the payment attempt failed, then this contains the index of the hop at which the problem occurred.

fields.name: attempted_at
fields.description: The date and time when the attempt was initiated.

fields.name: resolved_at
fields.description: The time the outgoing payment attempt failed or succeeded.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The total amount of funds required to complete a payment over this route. This value includes the cumulative fees for each hop. As a result, the attempt extended to the first-hop in the route will need to have at least this much value, otherwise the route will fail at an intermediate node due to an insufficient amount.

fields.name: fees
fields.description: The sum of the fees paid at each hop within the route of this attempt. In the case of a one-hop payment, this value will be zero as we don't need to pay a fee to ourselves.

fields.name: hops
fields.description: A list of hops that represent the route from the sender node to the recipient node.

fields.name: outgoing_payment
fields.description: The outgoing payment for this attempt.

fields.name: channel_snapshot
fields.description: The channel snapshot at the time the outgoing payment attempt was made.

types.description: This is an enum of all potential statuses of a payment attempt made from a Lightspark Node.

types.name: OutgoingPaymentAttemptToHopsConnection
types.description: The connection from an outgoing payment attempt to the list of sequential hops that define the path from sender node to recipient node.

fields.name: page_info
fields.description: An object that holds pagination information about the objects in this connection.

fields.name: entities
fields.description: The hops for the current page of this connection.

types.name: WithdrawalRequest
types.description: This object represents a request made for an L1 withdrawal from your Lightspark Node to any Bitcoin wallet. You can retrieve this object to receive detailed information about any withdrawal request made from your Lightspark account.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of this entity across all Lightspark systems. Should be treated as an opaque string.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The date and time when the entity was first created.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description: The date and time when the entity was last updated.

fields.name: requested_amount
fields.description: The requested amount of money to be withdrawn. If the requested amount is -1, it means to withdraw all.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of money that should be withdrawn in this request.

fields.name: estimated_amount
fields.description: If the requested amount is `-1` (i.e. everything), this field may contain an estimate of the amount for the withdrawal.

fields.name: amount_withdrawn
fields.description: The actual amount that is withdrawn to the bitcoin address. It will be set once the request is completed.

fields.name: total_fees
fields.description: The total fees the node paid for the withdrawal. It will be set once the request is completed.

fields.name: bitcoin_address
fields.description: The bitcoin address where the funds should be sent.

fields.name: withdrawal_mode
fields.description: The strategy that should be used to withdraw the funds from the account.
fields.deprecationReason: It is always withdrawing from channels now.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of this withdrawal request.

fields.name: completed_at
fields.description: The time at which this request was completed.

fields.name: withdrawal
fields.description: The withdrawal transaction that has been generated by this request.

fields.name: channel_closing_transactions
fields.description: The transactions that have been generated when closing channels to fulfill this withdrawal.

types.name: WalletStatus
types.description: This is an enum of the potential statuses that your Lightspark wallet can take.

enumValues.name: NOT_SETUP
enumValues.description: The wallet has not been set up yet and is ready to be deployed. This is the default status after the first login.

enumValues.name: DEPLOYING
enumValues.description: The wallet is currently being deployed in the Lightspark infrastructure.

enumValues.name: DEPLOYED
enumValues.description: The wallet has been deployed in the Lightspark infrastructure and is ready to be initialized.

enumValues.name: INITIALIZING
enumValues.description: The wallet is currently being initialized.

enumValues.name: READY
enumValues.description: The wallet is available and ready to be used.

enumValues.name: UNAVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The wallet is temporarily available, due to a transient issue or a scheduled maintenance.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The wallet had an unrecoverable failure. This status is not expected to happend and will be investigated by the Lightspark team.

enumValues.name: TERMINATING
enumValues.description: The wallet is being terminated.

enumValues.name: TERMINATED
enumValues.description: The wallet has been terminated and is not available in the Lightspark infrastructure anymore. It is not connected to the Lightning network and its funds can only be accessed using the Funds Recovery flow.

types.description: This is an object representing an UMA.ME invitation.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of this entity across all Lightspark systems. Should be treated as an opaque string.

fields.description: The code that uniquely identifies this invitation.

fields.description: The URL where this invitation can be claimed.

fields.description: The UMA of the user who created the invitation.

fields.description: The UMA of the user who claimed the invitation.

types.name: IncentivesStatus
types.description: Describes the status of the incentives for this invitation.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The invitation is eligible for incentives in its current state. When it is claimed, we will reassess.

enumValues.name: VALIDATED
enumValues.description: The incentives have been validated.

enumValues.name: INELIGIBLE
enumValues.description: This invitation is not eligible for incentives. A more detailed reason can be found in the `incentives_ineligibility_reason` field.

types.name: IncentivesIneligibilityReason
types.description: Describes the reason for an invitation to not be eligible for incentives.

enumValues.name: DISABLED
enumValues.description: This invitation is not eligible for incentives because it has been created outside of the incentives flow.

enumValues.name: SENDER_NOT_ELIGIBLE
enumValues.description: This invitation is not eligible for incentives because the sender is not eligible.

enumValues.name: RECEIVER_NOT_ELIGIBLE
enumValues.description: This invitation is not eligible for incentives because the receiver is not eligible.

enumValues.name: SENDING_VASP_NOT_ELIGIBLE
enumValues.description: This invitation is not eligible for incentives because the sending VASP is not part of the incentives program.

enumValues.name: RECEIVING_VASP_NOT_ELIGIBLE
enumValues.description: This invitation is not eligible for incentives because the receiving VASP is not part of the incentives program.

enumValues.name: NOT_CROSS_BORDER
enumValues.description: This invitation is not eligible for incentives because the sender and receiver are in the same region.

fields.name: fee_estimate
fields.description: The estimated fee for the withdrawal.

inputFields.description: The node from which you'd like to make the withdrawal.

inputFields.name: amount_sats
inputFields.description: The amount you want to withdraw from this node in Satoshis. Use the special value -1 to withdrawal all funds from this node.

inputFields.name: withdrawal_mode
inputFields.description: The strategy that should be used to withdraw the funds from this node.

fields.name: cancel_invoice
fields.description: Cancel an invoice.

fields.name: claim_uma_invitation
fields.description: Claims an UMA.ME invitation. If you are a VASP part of the incentives program, you should likely use `claim_uma_invitation_with_incentives`

fields.name: claim_uma_invitation_with_incentives
fields.description: Claims an UMA.ME invitation as part of the incentives program.

fields.name: create_api_token
fields.description: This function creates a new API token that can be used to authenticate requests for this account when using the Lightspark APIs and SDKs.

fields.name: create_invoice
fields.description: This function generates a Lightning Invoice (following the Bolt 11 specification). This invoice can be used to request a payment from any other Lightning Node. If you are in test mode, the generated invoice can only be paid by the create_test_mode_payment mutation.

fields.name: create_lnurl_invoice
fields.description: This function generates a Lightning Invoice (following the Bolt 11 specification). This invoice can be used to request a payment from any other Lightning Node. This function should only be used for generating invoices for LNURLs, with `create_invoice` preferred in the general case.

fields.name: create_uma_invoice
fields.description: This function generates a Lightning Invoice (following the Bolt 11 specification). This invoice can be used to request a payment from any other Lightning Node. This function should only be used for generating invoices for the UMA protocol.

fields.name: create_node_wallet_address
fields.description: This function creates a Bitcoin address for the wallet associated with your Lightning Node. You can use this address to send funds to your node. It is a best practice to generate a new wallet address every time you need to send money. You can generate as many wallet addresses as you want.

fields.name: create_test_mode_invoice
fields.description: In test mode, this function generates a Lightning Invoice payable to the Lightspark test node that your node has an open channel with.

fields.name: create_test_mode_payment
fields.description: In test mode, this function simulates sending a payment from a Lightspark test node to your Lightspark node given an invoice.

fields.name: create_uma_invitation
fields.description: Creates an UMA.ME invitation. If you are a VASP part of the incentives program, you should likely use `create_uma_invitation_with_incentives`.

fields.name: create_uma_invitation_with_incentives
fields.description: Creates an UMA.ME invitation as part of the incentives program.

fields.name: decline_to_sign_messages
fields.description: Declines signing for the provided payloads because validation failed. This results in a force closure of the channel that provided these transactions.

fields.name: delete_api_token
fields.description: Deletes an existing API token from your Lightspark account.

fields.name: fail_htlcs
fields.description: Fail all pending htlcs of a given invoice. It should only be called if the invoice is created by a remote signing node.

fields.name: fund_node
fields.description:
Adds funds to a Lightspark node in test mode, on the REGTEST network. If the amount is not specified, 10,000,000 SATOSHI will be added.
This API only functions for nodes created on the REGTEST network and will return an error when called for any non-REGTEST node.

fields.name: pay_invoice
fields.description: Sends a payment to a node on the Lightning Network, based on the invoice (as defined by the BOLT11 specification) that you provide. If you are in test mode, the invoice has to be generated by the create_test_mode_invoice mutation.

fields.name: pay_uma_invoice
fields.description: Sends a payment to a node on the Lightning Network as part of the UMA protocol, based on the invoice (as defined by the BOLT11 specification) that you provide. If you are in test mode, the invoice has to be generated by the create_test_mode_invoice mutation.

fields.name: register_payment
fields.description: This function registers a successful payment with the given compliance provider. In order to call this API, you need to be a customer with the selected compliance provider and have the API key stored on your Lightspark account setting page.

fields.name: release_channel_per_commitment_secret
fields.description: Release per commitment secret of a channel connecting to a local remote signing node.

fields.name: release_payment_preimage
fields.description: Release the payment preimage for an invoice.

fields.name: request_withdrawal
fields.description:
Withdraws funds from the account and sends it to the requested bitcoin address.

Depending on the chosen mode, it will first take the funds from the wallet, and if applicable, close channels appropriately to recover enough funds and reopen channels with the remaining funds.
The process is asynchronous and may take up to a few minutes. You can check the progress by polling the `WithdrawalRequest` that is created, or by subscribing to a webhook.

fields.name: send_payment
fields.description: Sends a payment directly to a node on the Lightning Network through the public key of the node without an invoice.

fields.name: screen_node
fields.description: This function screens a lightning node using the specified provider and returns a risk rating, for the purpose of risk or compliance assessments. In order to call this API, you need to be a customer with the selected compliance provider and have the API key stored on your Lightspark account setting page.

fields.name: set_invoice_payment_hash
fields.description: Set the payment hash for an invoice.

fields.name: sign_invoice
fields.description: Sign an invoice generated from a remote signing node.

fields.name: sign_messages
fields.description: Upload the signatures of a list of messages that need to be signed.

fields.name: update_channel_per_commitment_point
fields.description: Updates per commitment point of a channel connecting to a local remote signing node.

fields.name: update_node_shared_secret
fields.description: Updates shared secret of a remote signing node.

fields.name: pay_test_mode_invoice
fields.description: Simulates various payment failure scenarios for testing purposes.

types.name: CancelInvoiceOutput
types.description: The Invoice that was cancelled. If the invoice was already cancelled, the same invoice is returned.

types.name: CancelInvoiceInput
types.description: The unique identifier of the Invoice that should be cancelled. The invoice is supposed to be open, not settled and not expired.

fields.name: api_token
fields.description: The API Token that has been created.

fields.name: client_secret
fields.description:
The secret that should be used to authenticate against our API.
This secret is not stored and will never be available again after this. You must keep this secret secure as it grants access to your account.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: An arbitrary name that the user can choose to identify the API token in a list.

inputFields.name: permissions
inputFields.description: List of permissions to grant to the API token

inputFields.name: node_id
inputFields.description: The node from which to create the invoice.

inputFields.name: amount_msats
inputFields.description: The amount for which the invoice should be created, in millisatoshis. Setting the amount to 0 will allow the payer to specify an amount.

inputFields.name: expiry_secs
inputFields.description: The expiry of the invoice in seconds. Default value is 86400 (1 day) for AMP invoice, or 3600 (1 hour) for STANDARD invoice.

inputFields.name: payment_hash
inputFields.description: The payment hash of the invoice. It should only be set if your node is a remote signing node. If not set, it will be requested through REMOTE_SIGNING webhooks with sub event type REQUEST_INVOICE_PAYMENT_HASH.

types.name: InvoiceType
types.description: This is an enum for potential invoice types.

enumValues.name: STANDARD
enumValues.description: A standard Bolt 11 invoice.

enumValues.name: AMP
enumValues.description: An AMP (Atomic Multi-path Payment) invoice.

inputFields.name: node_id
inputFields.description: The node from which to create the invoice.

inputFields.name: amount_msats
inputFields.description: The amount for which the invoice should be created, in millisatoshis.

inputFields.name: metadata_hash
inputFields.description: The SHA256 hash of the LNURL metadata payload. This will be present in the h-tag (SHA256 purpose of payment) of the resulting Bolt 11 invoice.

inputFields.name: expiry_secs
inputFields.description: The expiry of the invoice in seconds. Default value is 86400 (1 day).

inputFields.name: receiver_hash
inputFields.description: An optional, monthly-rotated, unique hashed identifier corresponding to the receiver of the payment.

inputFields.description: The node from which to create the invoice.

inputFields.name: expiry_secs

inputFields.name: receiver_hash

fields.name: multisig_wallet_address_validation_parameters

fields.name: funding_pubkey_derivation_path
fields.description: The derivation path used to derive the funding public key for the 2-of-2 multisig address.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of this entity across all Lightspark systems. Should be treated as an opaque string.

fields.description: The date and time when the entity was first created.

fields.description: The date and time when the entity was last updated.

inputFields.name: payload_ids
inputFields.description: List of payload ids to decline to sign because validation failed.

inputFields.name: invoice_id
inputFields.description: The id of invoice which the pending HTLCs that need to be failed are paying for.

inputFields.description: Whether the invoice needs to be canceled after failing the htlcs. If yes, the invoice cannot be paid anymore.

fields.name: payment
fields.description: The payment that has been sent.

inputFields.name: node_id
inputFields.description: The node from where you want to send the payment.

inputFields.name: encoded_invoice
inputFields.description: The invoice you want to pay (as defined by the BOLT11 standard).

inputFields.name: timeout_secs
inputFields.description: The timeout in seconds that we will try to make the payment.

inputFields.name: maximum_fees_msats
inputFields.description: The maximum amount of fees that you want to pay for this payment to be sent, expressed in msats.

inputFields.name: amount_msats
inputFields.description: The amount you will pay for this invoice, expressed in msats. It should ONLY be set when the invoice amount is zero.

inputFields.name: idempotency_key
inputFields.description: The idempotency key of the request. The same result will be returned for the same idempotency key.

inputFields.name: sender_hash
inputFields.description: An optional, monthly-rotated, unique hashed identifier corresponding to the sender of the payment.

inputFields.name: provider
inputFields.description: The compliance provider that is going to screen the node. You need to be a customer of the selected provider and store the API key on the Lightspark account setting page.

inputFields.name: payment_id
inputFields.description: The Lightspark ID of the lightning payment you want to register. It can be the id of either an OutgoingPayment or an IncomingPayment.

inputFields.name: node_pubkey
inputFields.description: The public key of the counterparty lightning node, which would be the public key of the recipient node if it is to register an outgoing payment, or the public key of the sender node if it is to register an incoming payment.

inputFields.name: direction
inputFields.description: Indicates whether this payment is an OutgoingPayment or an IncomingPayment.

types.name: ComplianceProvider
types.description: This is an enum identifying a type of compliance provider.

types.name: PaymentDirection
types.description: This is an enum indicating the direction of the payment.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The channel object after the per-commitment secret release operation.

inputFields.name: channel_id
inputFields.description: The unique identifier of the channel.

inputFields.name: per_commitment_secret
inputFields.description: The per-commitment secret to be released.

inputFields.name: per_commitment_index
inputFields.description: The index associated with the per-commitment secret.

fields.name: invoice
fields.description: The invoice of the transaction.

inputFields.name: invoice_id
inputFields.description: The invoice the preimage belongs to.

inputFields.name: payment_preimage
inputFields.description: The preimage to release.

fields.name: request
fields.description: The request that is created for this withdrawal.

inputFields.name: node_id
inputFields.description: The node from which you'd like to make the withdrawal.

inputFields.name: bitcoin_address
inputFields.description: The bitcoin address where the withdrawal should be sent.

inputFields.name: amount_sats
inputFields.description: The amount you want to withdraw from this node in Satoshis. Use the special value -1 to withdrawal all funds from this node.

inputFields.name: withdrawal_mode
inputFields.description: The strategy that should be used to withdraw the funds from this node.

inputFields.name: idempotency_key
inputFields.description: The idempotency key of the request. The same result will be returned for the same idempotency key.

inputFields.name: fee_target
inputFields.description: The target of the fee that should be used when crafting the L1 transaction. You should only set `fee_target` or `sats_per_vbyte`. If neither of them is set, default value of MEDIUM will be used as `fee_target`.

inputFields.name: sats_per_vbyte
inputFields.description: A manual fee rate set in sat/vbyte that should be used when crafting the L1 transaction. You should only set `fee_target` or `sats_per_vbyte`

enumValues.name: HIGH
enumValues.description: Transaction expected to be confirmed within 2 blocks.

enumValues.name: MEDIUM
enumValues.description: Transaction expected to be confirmed within 6 blocks.

enumValues.name: LOW
enumValues.description: Transaction expected to be confirmed within 18 blocks.

enumValues.name: BACKGROUND

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
